New Records: Klaasen-Miller set NY partnership record with a 79-run stand, the highest fifth-wicket stand at Eisenhower Park and South Africa's highest fifth-wicket stand in T20Is.
Tanzim Hasan achieved his career-best figures of 3 for 18 in four overs, the best figures by a Bangladesh seamer against South Africa and the second-best overall.
Key Match Events: Keshav Maharaj defended 10 runs in the last over, including three full tosses, to secure a four-run win for South Africa.
Aiden Markram took a stunning running catch at long-on to dismiss Mahmudullah, a pivotal moment in the match.
Anrich Nortje finished his four overs with figures of 2 for 17, becoming one away from the joint leading wicket-taker at the tournament.
Tanzim Hasan took the key wickets of Reeza Hendricks, Quinton de Kock, and Tristan Stubbs, contributing significantly to Bangladesh's bowling effort.
David Miller was dropped by Litton Das on 13, which could have been a turning point in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Aiden Markram decided to bat first on a used wicket despite chasing being the preferred strategy in New York.
South Africa went in with an unchanged XI from their previous two wins, while Bangladesh made one change with Tanzid Hassan coming in for Soumya Sarkar.
Experts highlighted Rishad Hossain as a potential threat to South Africa's lineup due to their historical weakness against spin.
Post-Match Reflections: Keshav Maharaj expressed relief and pride in defending 10 runs in the final over.
South Africa's victory put them in pole position to claim their spot in the Super Sixes, while Bangladesh still had opportunities to advance by playing against Nepal and Netherlands.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of a large crowd of 22,658 spectators at Eisenhower Park, predominantly supporting Bangladesh.
The pitch conditions at Eisenhower Park were challenging, making a target of 114 difficult to chase.
